page.title: 03Laughton, Hopes and Fears, 2
page.content: Newcomers are helping to change the village but she has nothing against them, because they haven't made the village any noisier. She even thought that an extra general store would help to provide a better variety of goods. Entertainment is not good in the village and this could be improved she thought. There are plenty of pubs which she doesn't mind so long as "people keep themselves to themselves". Mrs. Hoggard also said that she was worried if there was a nuclear war. She was also in favour of computers even though some people don't like them. We thought that her greatest fear was that she would soon have to retire from our school as a cook. She said that she loves working with children at the school where she has been for 20 years.
